soc.client

Class NewGameOptionsFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • soc.client.NewGameOptionsFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    class NewGameOptionsFrame
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    This is the dialog for a game's name and options to set, along with the client's user preferences such as SOCPlayerClient.PREF_SOUND_ON and per-game preferences such as SOCPlayerInterface.PREF_SOUND_MUTE. When "Create" button is clicked, validates fields and calls MainDisplay#askStartGameWithOptions(String, boolean, SOCGameOptionSet, Map).

    Also used for showing a game's options (read-only) during game play.

    Changes to the PREF_SOUND_ON or PREF_SOUND_MUTE checkboxes take effect immediately so the user can mute sound effects with minimal frustration. Other user preferences take effect only when Create/OK button is pressed, and not if Cancel or Escape key is pressed.

    If this window already exists and you'd like to make it topmost, call setVisible(boolean) instead of Component.requestFocus().

    Game option "SC" (Scenarios) gets special rendering. Internally it's SOCGameOption.OTYPE_STR, but it's presented as a checkbox and JComboBox. When a scenario is picked in the JComboBox, related options are updated by "SC"'s SOCGameOption.ChangeListener.

    This class also contains the "Scenario Info" popup window, called from this dialog's Scenario Info button, and from SOCPlayerInterface when first joining a game with a scenario: See showScenarioInfoDialog(SOCScenario, SOCGameOptionSet, SOCGameOptionSet, int, MainDisplay, Window).

    Although this class was changed in v2.0 from a Frame to a JDialog, it's still named "NewGameOptionsFrame": Many commit messages and local vars refer to "NGOF".

    Since:
    1.1.07
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>

    • Field Detail

      • INTFIELD_POPUP_MAXRANGE

        public static final int INTFIELD_POPUP_MAXRANGE
        Maximum range (min-max value) for integer-type options to be rendered using a value popup, instead of a textfield.
        See Also:
        initOption_int(SOCGameOption), Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • NewGameOptionsFrame

        public NewGameOptionsFrame(SOCPlayerInterface pi,
                           MainDisplay md,
                           java.lang.String gameName,
                           SOCGameOptionSet opts,
                           boolean forPractice,
                           boolean readOnly)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new NewGameOptionsFrame. Once created, resets the mouse cursor from hourglass to normal, and clears main panel's status text.

        See also convenience method createAndShow(SOCPlayerInterface, MainDisplay, String, SOCGameOptionSet, boolean, boolean).

        Parameters:
        pi - Interface of existing game, or null for a new game. Used for updating settings like SOCPlayerInterface.isSoundMuted().
        md - Client's main display interface
        gameName - Name of existing game, or null for new game; will be blank or (forPractice) to use SOCPlayerClient.DEFAULT_PRACTICE_GAMENAME.
        opts - Set of SOCGameOptions; its values will be changed when "New Game" button is pressed, so the next OptionsFrame will default to the values the user has chosen. To preserve them, copy the set beforehand. Null if server doesn't support game options. Unknown options (SOCGameOption.OTYPE_UNKNOWN) will be removed. If not readOnly, each option's userChanged flag will be cleared, to reset status from any previously shown NewGameOptionsFrame.
        forPractice - For making a new game: Will the game be on local practice server, vs remote tcp server?
        readOnly - Is this display-only (for use during a game), or can it be changed (making a new game)?
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a non-null opts is the client's knownOpts from ServerGametypeInfo.knownOpts, which should be copied before use for a new game's options

    • Method Detail

      • createAndShow

        public static NewGameOptionsFrame createAndShow(SOCPlayerInterface pi,
                                                MainDisplay md,
                                                java.lang.String gameName,
                                                SOCGameOptionSet opts,
                                                boolean forPractice,
                                                boolean readOnly)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates and shows a new NewGameOptionsFrame. Once created, resets the mouse cursor from hourglass to normal, and clears main panel's status text. See constructor for notes about opts and other parameters.
        Parameters:
        pi - Interface of existing game, or null for a new game; see constructor
        gameName - Name of existing game, or null to show options for a new game; see constructor for details
        Returns:
        the new frame
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a non-null opts is the client's knownOpts from ServerGametypeInfo.knownOpts, which should be copied before use for a new game's options

        When the window is shown, request focus on game name textfield. To make this window topmost, call setVisible(true) instead of Component.requestFocus().

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        React to button clicks.

        Even in read-only mode for a current game, the "OK" button saves (persists) this dialog's local preferences for use in future games.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • textChanged

        public void textChanged(javax.swing.event.DocumentEvent e)
        When gamename contents change, enable/disable buttons as appropriate. (DocumentListener) Also handles SOCGameOption.OTYPE_INTBOOL textfield/checkbox combos. Also sets SOCGameOption.userChanged.

        Before v2.0.00 this was textValueChanged (AWT TextListener).

        Parameters:
        e - event from gameName, or from a JTextField in controlsOpts

      • itemStateChanged

        public void itemStateChanged(java.awt.event.ItemEvent e)
        Called when a JComboBox or JCheckbox value changes (ItemListener). Used for these things:
        • Set SOCGameOption.userChanged
        • Check JComboBoxes or JCheckboxes to see if their game option has a ChangeListener.
        • Set the checkbox when the popup-menu JComboBox value is changed for a SOCGameOption.OTYPE_INTBOOL or SOCGameOption.OTYPE_ENUMBOOL.
        • Update game option "SC" and the scenInfo button when a scenario is picked from scenDropdown. Other scenario-related updates are handled by this method calling SOCGameOption.ChangeListener#valueChanged(SOCGameOption, Object, Object, SOCGameOptionSet, SOCGameOptionSet).
        Specified by:
        itemStateChanged in interface java.awt.event.ItemListener
        Parameters:
        e - itemevent from a JComboBox or JCheckbox in controlsOpts

      • showScenarioInfoDialog

        public static void showScenarioInfoDialog(SOCGame ga,
                                          SOCGameOptionSet knownOpts,
                                          MainDisplay md,
                                          java.awt.Window parent)
        Show a popup window with this game's scenario's description, special rules, and number of victory points to win. Calls EventQueue.invokeLater(Runnable).
        Parameters:
        ga - Game to display scenario info for; if game option "SC" missing or blank, does nothing.
        knownOpts - Server's Known Options, from ServerGametypeInfo.knownOpts
        md - Player client's main display, for NotifyDialog call
        parent - Current game's player interface, or another Frame or Dialog for our parent window, or null to look for cli's Frame/Dialog as parent
        Since:
        2.0.00

      • showScenarioInfoDialog

        public static void showScenarioInfoDialog(SOCScenario sc,
                                          SOCGameOptionSet gameOpts,
                                          SOCGameOptionSet knownOpts,
                                          int vpWinner,
                                          MainDisplay md,
                                          java.awt.Window parent)
        Show a popup window with this scenario's description, special rules, and number of victory points to win. Calls EventQueue.invokeLater(Runnable).
        Parameters:
        sc - A SOCScenario, or null to do nothing
        gameOpts - All game options if current game, or null to extract from sc's SOCScenario.scOpts
        knownOpts - Server's Known Options, from ServerGametypeInfo.knownOpts
        vpWinner - Number of victory points to win, or SOCGame.VP_WINNER_STANDARD.
        md - Player client's main display, required for AskDialog constructor
        parent - Current game's player interface, or another Frame or Dialog for our parent window, or null to look for cli's Frame/Dialog as parent
        Since:
        2.0.00
